thread.title: Kennedy Center to offer free concert in honor of Pope Francis
thread.title_full: Kennedy Center to offer free concert in honor of Pope Francis

author: Tim Smith
title: Kennedy Center to offer free concert in honor of Pope Francis
text:
Entertainment Arts Artsmash Kennedy Center to offer free concert in honor of Pope Francis Pope Francis shares a light moment surrounded by bishops and priest during his weekly audience in Saint Peter's square at the Vatican on Sept. 2, 2015. VINCENZO PINTO / AFP/Getty Images 
Pope Francis shares a light moment surrounded by bishops and priest during his weekly audience in Saint Peter's square at the Vatican on Sept. 2, 2015. 
Pope Francis shares a light moment surrounded by bishops and priest during his weekly audience in Saint Peter's square at the Vatican on Sept. 2, 2015. (VINCENZO PINTO / AFP/Getty Images) Tim Smith Contact Reporter The Baltimore Sun Pope Francis won't be there, but his admirers are sure to pack a concert at the Kennedy Center in his honor. 
If you are not on the guest list for the events involving Pope Francis in Washington later this month, the Kennedy Center is offering a musical consolation prize. 
A free concert in the Pope's honor will be held at 8 p.m. Sept. 23 featuring the National Symphony Orchestra, mezzo-soprano Denyce Graves and 10-year-old jazz pianist José André Montaño. 
Pope Francis will not be in attendance, but his spirit will be, in the form of a message from the pontiff that will be read by Cardinal Donald Wuerl, Archbishop of Washington. 
Kennedy Center President Deborah F. Rutter said in a statement that the Pope's "visionarymessage advocating tolerance and understanding for others communicates an ideal shared by all of us at the Kennedy Center." 
The program will include portions of Mozart's "Exsultate, jubilate" and Holst's "The Planets" (the movement "Venus, the Bringer of Peace"), as well as Cesar Franck's "Panis angelicus."
